posts.post_content:
Oh my god. Did... did someone actually make [Rainbow Vale](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rainbow Vale) *playable*?  
  
It's a shame token creatures are owned by the person who puts them into play, or [Varchild's War-Riders](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Varchild's War-Riders) would be even more potentially broken than they already are. Still, this can provide endless hours of unbridled hilarity. [Illusions of Grandeur](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Illusions of Grandeur) and [Delusions of Mediocrity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Delusions of Mediocrity) spring to mind.
posts.html:
Oh my god. Did... did someone actually make Rainbow Vale playable?

It's a shame token creatures are owned by the person who puts them into play, or Varchild's War-Riders would be even more potentially broken than they already are. Still, this can provide endless hours of unbridled hilarity. Illusions of Grandeur and Delusions of Mediocrity spring to mind.

Posted By: Redigo (6/20/2011 8:42:45 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@caldur06: Maybe even "Zedruu the Goat-herded" ;)  
  
But she indeed is greathearded: she shows that being generous improves your mental health and awareness :D  
  
Being triple-colored i'd have liked her more without the colorless mana in the activation cost, but she has still a very interesting upkeep trigger nonetheless.  
  
[Confusion in the Ranks](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Confusion in the Ranks) and [Puca's Mischief](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Puca's Mischief) are probably the most fun cards with this. The trick is to keep her on your side of the field then obviously...because let's face it, in the end we're not really that generous. At least not to our opponents :P
posts.html:
@caldur06: Maybe even "Zedruu the Goat-herded" ;)

But she indeed is greathearded: she shows that being generous improves your mental health and awareness :D

Being triple-colored i'd have liked her more without the colorless mana in the activation cost, but she has still a very interesting upkeep trigger nonetheless.

Confusion in the Ranks and Puca's Mischief are probably the most fun cards with this. The trick is to keep her on your side of the field then obviously...because let's face it, in the end we're not really that generous. At least not to our opponents :P

posts.post_content:
"Play [Thought Lash](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thought Lash). Wait for your upkeep. Cumulative Upkeep on the stack. Donate [Thought Lash](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thought Lash). Donation resolves. Fail to pay the Cumulative Upkeep. Thought Lash's ability triggers, removing it's controller's library from the game. Boom. Headshot."  
  
-A very smart man.
posts.html:

-A very smart man.

posts.post_content:
Great political tool, and of course you can build around things that don't actually benefit your opponents if they control them.  
[Grid Monitor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grid Monitor), [Steel Golem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Steel Golem), and of course, [Illusions of Grandeur](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Illusions of Grandeur) come to mind.  
Hey, it even makes [Darksteel Relic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Relic) less useless (for you, anyway.)  
  
Side note: Minotaur? That's clearly a Goat Monk.
posts.html:
Great political tool, and of course you can build around things that don't actually benefit your opponents if they control them.
Grid Monitor, Steel Golem, and of course, Illusions of Grandeur come to mind.
Hey, it even makes Darksteel Relic less useless (for you, anyway.)

Side note: Minotaur? That's clearly a Goat Monk.

Posted By: Artscrafter (6/17/2011 8:40:32 AM)

posts.post_content:
It is the will of Zedruu that you should have … this Howling Mine.  
Take it.  
I bequeath it to you.  
While you possess it, it shall draw both of us extra cards.  
I’m going to gain a life now.  
It is the will of Zedruu that you should have … these Goblin Cadets.  
May they serve you well. Although they flinch in battle, they occasionally reach through to an opponent.  
I want you to have them.  
I will be over here, drawing extra cards.  
It is the will of Zedruu that you should have … the rest of this sandwich.  
Do you not want the rest of this sandwich?  
I haven’t even eaten half of it.  
It is good, it is an asiago turkey club.  
From Panera.  
Right, the one near the college.  
It is the will of Zedruu that you should take the sandwich, and finish most of it.  
Take it. I insist.  
  
http://magiclampoon.com/blog/2011/06/19/it-is-the-will-of-zedruu  
  
I will be over here, gaining extra life.

Posted By: Zoroaster85 (3/2/2013 10:17:51 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I like using her in EDH to donate [Azor's Elocutors](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Azor's Elocutors), [Barren Glory](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Barren Glory), and [Test of Endurance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Test of Endurance) ... it nets you huge goodwill from the person you gave it to (and incentive for them to keep you alive, while subtly putting a target on their head instead)   
  
To keep people from attacking me I run tax/stall effects like [Propaganda](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Propaganda), [Norn's Annex](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Norn's Annex) and a donated [Ensnaring Bridge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ensnaring Bridge)  
  
The politics with Zedruu is amazing, your opponents like you for giving them a gleam of hope (and a huge target on their back) while you draw cards and gain life from the shadows.
posts.html:

To keep people from attacking me I run tax/stall effects like Propaganda, Norn's Annex and a donated Ensnaring Bridge

The politics with Zedruu is amazing, your opponents like you for giving them a gleam of hope (and a huge target on their back) while you draw cards and gain life from the shadows.

Posted By: Redmag3 (1/21/2013 1:35:16 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
You can let your opponents "control" any auras, they still do not stop enchanting whatever they were cast upon. This doesn't work well with auras that have activation costs, however.  
  
[Paradox Haze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Paradox Haze)  
[Spreading Seas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spreading Seas)  
  
Add [Sovereigns of Lost Alara](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sovereigns of Lost Alara) and [Bruna, Light of Alabaster](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bruna, Light of Alabaster) to make this a "tron" type deck, that beats [Uril, The Miststalker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Uril, The Miststalker) and [Zur the Enchanter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zur the Enchanter) using auras. Zur decks like using [Necropotence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necropotence), [Bitterblossom](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bitterblossom) or [Phyrexian Arena](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Arena), just [Commandeer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Commandeer) that "ish." If you're taking advantage of card draw, [Niv-Mizzet, the Firemind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Niv-Mizzet, the Firemind), [Well of Lost Dreams](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Well of Lost Dreams) & [Drogskol Reaver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Drogskol Reaver) could help...  
  
Zedruu Tron Auras...  
[Empyrial Armor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Empyrial Armor)  
[Arcanum Wings](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arcanum Wings)  
[Unquestioned Authority/autocard](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unquestioned Authority/autocard)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
You can let your opponents "control" any auras, they still do not stop enchanting whatever they were cast upon. This doesn't work well with auras that have activation costs, however.

Paradox Haze
Spreading Seas

Add Sovereigns of Lost Alara and Bruna, Light of Alabaster to make this a "tron" type deck, that beats Uril, The Miststalker and Zur the Enchanter using auras. Zur decks like using Necropotence, Bitterblossom or Phyrexian Arena, just Commandeer that "ish." If you're taking advantage of card draw, Niv-Mizzet, the Firemind, Well of Lost Dreams & Drogskol Reaver could help...

Zedruu Tron Auras...
Empyrial Armor
Arcanum Wings
Unquestioned Authority/autocard... (see all)

posts.post_content:
Nobody seems to have noticed that it says, "Target opponent gains control of target permanent you *control*".  
  
Take someone's big, mean something with [Traitorous Blood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Traitorous Blood). Swing away with it, and then toss it off to someone the original owner might not be getting along with. Or the guy getting pummeled. Or the hot chick.  
  
Plus, you can always gift someone your [Sorrow's Path](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sorrow's Path).
posts.html:
Nobody seems to have noticed that it says, "Target opponent gains control of target permanent you control".

Take someone's big, mean something with Traitorous Blood. Swing away with it, and then toss it off to someone the original owner might not be getting along with. Or the guy getting pummeled. Or the hot chick.

Plus, you can always gift someone your Sorrow's Path.
